data.name: Nth Root of a Number Reduxâ€¦ Redux!
data.description:
Part of Series 3/3

This kata is part of a series on computing the nth root of a number. It was inspired by [Nth Root of a Number][series-1] by [@afonsomatos][afonso]. Make sure you solve the [first][series-1] and the [second part][series-2] before you try this one.

# Task Given two numbers `x` and `n`, calculate the nth root of x, e.g. `r` such that `r^n = x`. However, your using a legacy library that doesn't contain several useful functions, see below. # Examples ```javascript root(4, 2); // 2 root(8, 3); // 2 root(256, 4); // 4 root(9, 2); // 3 ``` ```haskell -- (~~~) stands for almost equal, given that we're using floating point numbers root 4 2 ~~~ 2 root 8 3 ~~~ 2 root 256 4 ~~~ 4 root 9 2 ~~~ 3 ```
Spoilers ahead!

The following description contains hints on another kata. Make sure that you've solved [the previous part of the series][series-2] before you read the next part.

# Disabled features Language | Disabled features -----------|------------------ JavaScript | Many useful Math functions has been disabled. Haskell | The used type doesn't have a Floating instance. [series-1]: http://www.codewars.com/kata/5520714decb43308ea000083 "Nth Root of a Number" [series-2]: http://www.codewars.com/kata/552679ea44a9e400b600124f "Nth Root of a Number Redux" [afonso]: http://www.codewars.com/users/541897976d82167b7d0011b5 "@afonsomatos' profile"
